page.title: 03Temple of Venus
page.content: The Temple of Venus was built by the first Earl of Fife for his wife,round about 1760. It was built on the Hill of Doune,which overlooks the towns of Banff and Macduff.Its height is 15.3m and its circumference is 15.8m. It has five arches round it but there are lots of cracks and moss on the stone walls. The temple,it is said,was used by sun-worshippers; it was also used as a place of shelter and as a look-out point.If you look to the north,you will see the sea. If you look to the east,you will see the Dounemount Hotel and lots of fields.Looking to the south you will see Duff House,the Golf Course and the River Deveron.To the west,lies the town of Banff and the beach.
